meanings.definition: To dismiss from a position of responsibility or trust.
meanings.sent1: The manager was cashiering the employee for constantly being late to work.
meanings.sent2: The company decided to cashier the dishonest employee after discovering he was stealing from the cash register.
meanings.sent3: After repeatedly forgetting to lock up the store, the owner had no choice but to cashier the forgetful employee.
meanings.sent4: The decision to cashier the team captain for cheating sent a strong message to the rest of the players.
meanings.sent5: The principal cashiered the student council president for breaking the school rules.

meanings.definition: The action of dismissing someone from a position of responsibility or trust.
meanings.sent1: The cashiering of the manager shocked the entire staff.
meanings.sent2: The cashiering of the treasurer left a vacancy in the financial department.
meanings.sent3: The sudden cashiering of the CEO caused chaos in the company.
meanings.sent4: The cashiering of the coach led to a new leadership structure in the team.
meanings.sent5: The cashiering of the supervisor was met with mixed reactions from the employees.
